summary: This document is an email chain from May 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel approval and logistics for prosecutors investigating the Epstein case. It details travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for victim interviews, and includes a discussion about a personal trip conflict and a reimbursement request for a cancellation fee.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: He is the approving official for travel requests related to the Epstein investigation, responding with approvals to requests from prosecutors.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption Unit (U.S. Attorney's Office)
persons.context: She coordinates travel logistics, processes reimbursement requests, and seeks clarification on travel details for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: The primary prosecutor requesting travel approval for the Epstein investigation, detailing flight and hotel plans for victim interviews in West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on travel approval emails related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Wanda Yu
persons.context: Copied on emails regarding travel reimbursement questions for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential traveler for victim interviews in Florida as part of the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential traveler for victim interviews in Florida as part of the Epstein investigation team.

connections.description: Alex requests and receives travel approval from Tyrrell for the Epstein investigation.
Alex coordinates travel logistics and reimbursement with Alleyne, the legal assistant.
They are part of the same prosecution team traveling for victim interviews in the Epstein case.
Alleyne seeks guidance from Tyrrell on reimbursement policy for a prosecutor's travel cancellation fee.

events.title: Travel for Epstein Victim Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prosecutors from the SDNY travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct meetings and interviews with victims as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Conflict with Personal San Francisco Trip
events.description: A prosecutor had a personal trip to San Francisco for a wedding scheduled for the same day as the return from the work trip, leading to a flight cancellation and a $100 fee.

events.title: Prior Travel Approval for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Prosecutors received approval for travel to West Palm Beach for the Epstein investigation the previous month.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: The earliest referenced travel request for the Epstein investigation, for meetings in West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale.

locations: New York City, New York (specifically LGA airport)
keyFacts: The document confirms active victim interviews were being conducted by SDNY prosecutors in West Palm Beach, Florida, in May 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation (case United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618).
The investigation is described as 'relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
Prosecutors requested and used a hotel conference room in West Palm Beach specifically for conducting victim interviews.
Travel logistics show coordination between multiple AUSAs (Alex, Alison, Maurene) and support staff, indicating a team effort on the case.
The email chain reveals internal government procedures for travel approval and reimbursement within the U.S. Attorney's Office for a high-profile investigation.
